values: In my last entry I spoke of reinvention. Due to the fact that I am still in the dark as to whether my new person will be lj-friendly, I make no promises to continue writing. I am presently wiping out all my friends and starting over. If you would like to be re-added, comment on this entry, and I will add you. However, please remember my warning that I may not continue writing in this journal, and even if I do, my words may add up to a completely different sum than they might otherwise have equaled. Don't say you weren't cautioned.

This is not another entry. This is reinvention. I am no longer the person that I was. I'm still not the person I will be. I'm in limbo.

To Be Continued...

You Are 26 Years Old
26
Under 12: You are a kid at heart. You still have an optimistic life view - and you look at the world with awe. 13-19: You are a teenager at heart. You question authority and are still trying to find your place in this world. 20-29: You are a twentysomething at heart. You feel excited about what's to come... love, work, and new experiences. 30-39: You are a thirtysomething at heart. You've had a taste of success and true love, but you want more! 40+: You are a mature adult. You've been through most of the ups and downs of life already. Now you get to sit back and relax.
What Age Do You Act?

I bought yet another book tonight. Why do I torture myself and rape my bank account by returning to the bookstore every day? *sigh* The book I bought is called "How I Became Stupid." It's about an intellectual who decides to make himself into an idiot so that he can better fit into society. At one point he tries to become an alcoholic because he has observed that alcoholics never say anything intelligent. However, before he makes his first visit to the bar, he goes to the library and checks out like five books on alcohol so that he can become an alcoholic the smart way. Haha. I haven't even read 15 pages yet, and I'm in love with it. I think I may be addicted to books, CDs, and writing pointless livejournal entries. I would rather be listening, reading, or writing than being with people. *yet another sigh* Oh well. At least I'll be an intelligent recluse.

Well, it's that time of year again. Everyone is writing super emo entries in their lj. I'll admit, I've come close to crying after reading a couple of them, but I refuse to succomb to peer pressure and write one myself. Instead, I will shake my head at all my past mistakes and listen to Apocolyptica. Welcome to the last three weeks of Beth's senior year.

Dearest,
I miss you. I'm still not sure how it's possible to miss someone you've never met, but there's no mistaking the feeling. I hope you're doing okay and not just making it through. I hope you're laughing every day--no tears allowed! Make the most of every moment; I'll be there to join you soon, so enjoy the "alone time" you have now. I'm praying for you, and I think about you constantly. Until we meet for the first time, goodbye and I love you.

Caroleigh Elizabeth Mooring

If I could combine all the attractive features in my guy friends, I would have the perfect boyfriend/husband.


-Graeson's sense of humor

-Charlie's concern for when a girl when she's hurting

-Adam's small and random acts of love for his girlfriend AND his girlfriend's mother

-Jason's musical abilities

-Donny's gentlemanly nature (holding open doors, offering his coat, etc.)

-AJ's devotion

-Cameron's love for the Lord and desire to be an example to those around him

-Paul's genuineness

-Steven's helpfulness

-Colin's way with words

-Greg's protectiveness of the people he loves

-Ryan Phillipe's looks

EDIT: -Josh's emo heart and great sense of style

Today all the seniors went to Freedom Park. It wasn't the most thrilling thing in the world, but I had fun. Rory and Kyle started a fire in the grill after Taylor and I complained about being cold. For the rest of the morning I smelled like campfire and I liked it. It started to get warmer around lunch time, and afterwards I laid in the sun and listened to A Thorn For Every Heart and Anadivine. 'Twas nice. We got back to school around 2:15, so they just let us leave early. I've got babysit tonight, so it's nice to be  home early and have some time to myself before I have to leave. Anyway, I've things to do, places to go, and people to see. Adios mis amigos.

So, I definitely just spent an hour and a half at Blockbuster while Charlie was working. One of his coworkers, Linda (who, by the way, was old enough to be either of our mothers), is really cool. Her and I spent most of the time picking on Charlie. It was really funny. Anyway, at one point Charlie was telling a customer about a movie and saying that it was really depressing, but I inserted that it had some genuinely hilarious parts in it. That's when he turned around, threw a Blockbuster apron at me, and said, "Hey, clock in, why don't ya?!" Haha. It was funny, but I was very embarrassed. So yeah, my night has been interesting so far. Too bad HG is the only school that doesn't have a teacher workday tomorrow. I've been invited to several "outings" tonight, but I can't go because apparently Christian students shouldn't be given any opportunity to spend time with "hell-bound public schoolers." Oh well. I know I should be doing homework right now, but what motivation do I have when I'm graduating in less than a month? Not only that, but now I'm just going to CP, so my grades don't even matter. Bah. Well, I'm going to go find something to inspire me. I'll talk to ya'll peoples later.



"Wait a minute; your stomach's filled with such hypocricy.
And is it the fact that you're an ordinary American?"
*Anadivine*

Not exactly that thrilling, but what the hell?

Your Linguistic Profile:

80% General American English
15% Yankee
5% Dixie
0% Midwestern
0% Upper Midwestern
What Kind of American English Do You Speak?

I'm at the Syska's house right now, and I got tired of just sitting around. Not much happened today except for the fact that I was on the verge of having an emotional breakdown at school, but somehow I managed to hold it off until I got home. I've been off my anti-depressants for about two months now, and even though I'm really glad I'm not taking them anymore, I've been really sensitive lately. Today, Lauren made a completely innocent comment about how I'm always perky when she's in a bad mood and how it pisses her off, and I almost started bawling right then and there. I just had to look away for a second and brush away a few tears before she saw me. I know that if my mom knew how I've been, she would make me start taking my pills again, but I love the way I can finally write poetry again, and I don't just feel numb all the time. I don't have to pretend to have emotions anymore--I actually have them! Anyway, I'm sure I'll be fine, I just need to "toughen up and stick it out," like my dad always says. I'm just so grateful that I have people like Jordyn, Christina, Greg, and Steven who are always there to listen when I've had a bad day. They have been Jesus to me so many times, and I just thank God that He put them in my life. I am so blessed to even know them at all. Well, I ought to go because I don't want Mr. and Mrs. Syska to come home to find me on their computer. I'll update again later. 

Just remember: Watch how Jesus did things, and then follow His example. It's the best advice you'll ever get.

Last night I went to dinner with Graeson. It was awkward and uncomfortable. I spent most of the time wishing I was with someone else.

So, today was Field Day, and the seniors won. Yes, it was a lovely feeling. Anyway, I had a lot of fun. 

I was a little disappointed to find out from Jordyn that one of my private conversations with someone is now being talked about by everyone in the youth group. (Well, maybe not everyone...) Still, I was really frustrated because I thought I could trust this person, but apparently not.

After school I decided to call Charlie because we haven't talked in a long time. He sounded like hell when he picked up the phone, and he proceeded to tell me that his grandfather had died. I don't know if his grandfather was saved, but I know Charlie isn't. He's having a hard time, and I know that all I can do is just pray and be there for him when he needs me.

I was having an especially hard time today with my emotions. I kept seeing all the couples at our school hugging, holding hands, etc. It was hard, but I kept reminding myself that I have something even better on the way. I just have to wait (although that's easier said than done).

Well, I'm out of things to say at the moment, but I'll update again later.

This afternoon when girls are getting in their last few minutes at the tanning bed, I will too. Tonight while most girls are getting their hair and make up done, I will too. Tonight while girls are slipping into their fancy dresses, I will too. Tonight when everyone leaves for the Prom, Jordyn, Christina, and I will leave for the Passage. Oh the joys of Prom-wear at Game Night.

Adventures in Babysitting

 

Me: Have you talked to Timothy lately?

Ania: Have you talked to Charlie?

 

Maren: Katie's a tomboy.

Rea: She's not a boy, Maren!

 

Maren: We spent so much money at Gap that they gave us this ball for free!

Rea: What's free?

Katie: It means you only have to pay like $20 to get it.

Maren: Or maybe even only 1!

 

Ania: Abby and I are going to watch Little House on the Prairie while the little kids watch Flipper.

Rea: But I want to watch Little House on the Prairie too!

Ania: You can't. You're too little for that. It's not like the books. It's got adult stuff in it.

Abby: Like what?

Ania: It's got fire in it.

 

Katie: Lately my mom has been getting me adult movies.

Me: Like what?

Katie: Well, like Homeward Bound, The Parent Trap, and now she even rented Flipper!

Well, this might be unwise of me to do, but I've been contemplating it all day. This is what I've decided: I'm going to write you a note. I'm going to tell you every last thing I've wanted to scream at you since I left you standing in the hall last week. You know who you are. I just pray you'll actually read this.

 

 

I got my first glimpse of you about 2 years ago. I saw you head banging at a church concert. You were going crazy, and you were dressed extremely weird. I even grimaced a little when I saw those ugly sneakers. But I saw your smile. It's the kind of smile that is so quirky, but it's obviously genuine. I remember asking someone if you had a girlfriend, and he told me "no" but looked at me like I was insane for asking. I introduced myself that night. You were friendly and a true gentleman. You were so polite and kind that I thought you were flirting at first. After a few weeks, though, I realized that's just who you were- "the nice guy." I liked talking to you. You made me feel important, like I always had something interesting to say and you couldn't wait to hear it. If I even seemed a little quieter than normal, you would pester me about it until I told you what was bothering me- and you didn't settle for vague answers like "school sucks" or "my family is a pain." I had a major crush on you for a long time, but it was unrequited. I eventually told you that I liked you, but I knew you already figured it out (I'm not good at hiding my feelings). Anyway, once I realized that I had no chance of ever "winning you over," I decided to move on and find another guy. I dated a couple guys, and I was very good at forgetting you when I was with them. Even after those relationships ended, I could keep you off my mind pretty easily because you stopped coming to youth group. It's not that hard to put someone out of your mind when they live an hour and a half away and you never see or talk to them. Then, you came back. You told me that you were attracted to me. I was so pleased, but still a little worried about the distance. I knew that you didn't know how to handle that. I was willing to try anyway, but I knew you weren't so confident. One day I read in your online journal that you met a girl that you thought was really cute. That bothered me (a lot more than I wish it did). I even asked you about it, but you kind of shrugged it off. Then one night after youth group you pulled me aside and told me that you didn't think we would work out. You gave a couple (in my opinion) lame excuses, and then you tried to apologize. I didn't want to hear it though. I walked off and then proceeded to ignore you the rest of the night. What girl wouldn't? My pride was hurt, and I was too confused to know what to say. I shared the situation with my best friend a couple nights later. She told me that I ought to confront you, but I knew that I couldn't do that. I had so much I wanted to say, but you know me- I always hold back to prevent making things worse. Well, it's a week later, and I can't hold back anymore. Here's the deal: I think that if you really liked me as much as you made it seem like you did, then you would be willing to take a risk and try to make this work. In spite of the distance and whatever else, you should TAKE A CHANCE ON ME. If you don't, well, fine. I can't say that won't hurt, but I'll deal. I won't fall apart and become this pathetic, simpering female if you "reject" me. I like you a lot, but I can make it without you. Still, I'd really like it if you'd give "us" a chance. You've never even been on a date with me! How do you know it won't work? Please think about this. Pray about it. If you still don't think it'll work, then fine. I can accept that. But please don't just walk away because that's the easiest thing to do. The greatest things in life are the things you worked for.

Yeah, so this wasn't exactly the most entertaining quiz I've ever taken, but what the heck- I'm bored!
You are Sally! You are the voice of reason, but it
seems nobody listens. You try and save the day
but end up getting saved. Hey, at least you
Jack right?

"Self harm is not suicide for me. I want people to notice it and ask me about my wounds. Never shy away, as long as you ask sensible questions then that is fine. It is ok not to know how to deal with it, but I wont be offended by sensible, guilt-free queries. 

Yes I hated myself, and I wouldn't have done it if I didn't. And I intially hated myself more because I did it, and then I realised that self harm was my safety value. Without it I would never have survived."






Does this make things clearer for those of you who refuse to understand?
I know my entries yesterday were rather depressing. I'm sorry if I caused anyone to worry. I'll be okay, I just have a lot going on right now. No need for concern. Thanks anyway.
I could die from the unspeakable things I do to my body.

Damn. Damn. Damn. That word is simply an angry word unless I damn something. Damn me. Why--please God, tell me why I have to miss him? I was fine one second, and then all of a sudden I'm crying "on the shoulder" of a stranger. I feel like my heart is in my throat and someone is reaching into my stomach and tearing out my insides. I don't want to marry him. Heck, I don't even want to date him. But, God, I want him in my life. You know how much he means to me. I would seriously give up my salvation for him (but that's a completely different matter). I love him. I have no choice. I will always love him. If he decides to leave for good this time, I will heal eventually. I know that. But it still hurts like Hell. And I know that at this very moment he's probably on the phone with a girl who doesn't know him like I do and certainly will never love him as much as I do. He's probably taken back his insipid, little freshman girlfriend with the boy's name. Remind me why I'm jealous... Because, even though I don't want him as a boyfriend, I am jealous of every second he spends with another girl when he could be talking to me. Instead, our "cycle" has gotten off track. It's been at least three months now. He's never taken that long to come back before. Should I be worried? I am. God, give me the strength to endure this.

So, today... I went to church this morning and it was AMAZING. The choir sang a new song that definitely caused me to get teary-eyed. Pastor talked about how Jesus may send me off into the middle of a storm while He heads in the opposite direction, but He's watching me and just waiting for me to cry out to Him. When the disciples were in the middle of the sea while the storm raged around them, Jesus walked out on the water and would have passed them by except that they called out to Him. That's when He came to their aid.

After church I went to lunch at Salsas with Britt, Liz, Erin, Heather Moore, Jeremy, Amanda, Katie, David, Jessy, and Adam. Afterwards Britt, Liz, Erin, Heather, and I went to Off Broadway to look at all the shoes we can't afford. I found a pair that I am definitely going back to buy tomorrow.

I came home and was able to squeeze in a nap before work, and they even let me off 30 minutes early tonight.

Now I'm just sitting here trying to think of how I'm going to start making changes at school tomorrow. There is a lot to be altered, and I'm really not sure where to start. I've already decided that I'm not going to sit with "the group" at lunch anymore. I'm not cutting them out of my life, I just think it would be healthy for me to distance myself a little. I'm also going to read my Bible and pray at least once a week during lunch. This Wednesday during the ninth grade discipleship meeting, I'm going to give my testimony. Other than these changes, I don't know, but I'm trusting God to show me.

I can't believe I'm about to graduate! It just doesn't seem like I'm old enough to graduate, but I'm certainly ready. I hope I can go to CIU, but God knows best, so I'll just wait and see.

That's about all the info I have for you guys right now, but I hope you know how honored I feel to have all of you in my life. You make things interesting for me! ;)

I want to create a new identity
Be reborn with uncalloused skin
I am so sick of me and all I represent
I refuse to change what I want to change
Laziness keeps me in the dark
Disgusted with volumes of bloody poetry
I frantically rip pages of my past
And primly print my name
On the top of a clean sheet of paper

Well, today was pretty sucky, but it has officially become the best day I've had in a long time for one reason: My mom told me I can quit Harris Teeter. I also have found a job babysitting fulltime this summer. To any of ya'll who have been praying for me, THANK YOU! It really has paid off. Moving on, I have decided that even though I'm not skinny, and even though there are plenty of things I could do to make myself more attractive, I am happy. Maybe happy isn't the right word... Maybe content is a better word. I have come to terms with the person I am, and I feel great. I still don't feel very pretty, but I know that I have a good heart and that God will allow the man I'm made for to see me as the most beautiful woman in the world. I'm excited about that, but I can wait because I know I have a lot of growing up to do. I mean, how could I possibly love someone with all my heart when I don't even love God that much? He's still working on me, but I'm feeling much more encouraged about the whole painful process now.

Okay, so today has been a really long day. Thank God (literally) that they let me off early today. It was a welcome relief.

Anyway, I would write about the way my day at school went, but anyone who goes to HG already knows, and anyone who doesn't seriously doesn't want to know. In short, my heart was broken by the complete lack of compassion and morals.

Well, I don't really have much to write about now, but just remember to pray for anything and everything you can think of. It does more good that any of us (including myself) can imagine.

Seeing as how my last entry could have led you to believe that I wrote it, I must clarify. The previous post was an excerpt from a favorite musician of mine who is in the process of writing his autobiography. I would encourage ya'll to check it out for yourselves, but unfortunately I injested many obscene words in the process of reading it. Therefore, I might occasionally quote a mild-by-comparison part of his story from time to time. I hope that reassures you that my dad is not quite so repulsive as you might have thought.

I'm going to update because I don't know what else to do. Everyone left for Chicago today. When they did the service this past Wednesday, I was in tears the whole time. This is the first year I haven't gone. I've been struggling with it all week, and today was the worst. I wanted to at least see them off, but I had to work. I did go over to Brittany's and talked with her while she packed before I had to go. I have to be honest, I think Brittany is my best friend. I had to leave abruptly because I knew I was going to start crying. I could barely see well enough to drive. I gave her my car buddy, Maxwell Jamison III, to take with her. She gave me a picture of a group of us girls that went last year, and I put it in my car. I miss her soooooooooo much already. I promised to call her and leave her messages and told her that she could call me Collect if she had to. Anyway, I know there's a reason I'm not going, but I still hate it. Oh well. I think I'm going to leave school early on Friday so I can meet everyone when they get back to the church at noon. That'll be fun.

Surprise, surprise.
You scored as Christianity. Your views are most similar to those of Christianity. Do more research on Christianity and possibly consider being baptized and accepting Jesus, if you aren't already Christian. Christianity is the second of the Abrahamic faiths; it follows Judaism and is followed by Islam. It differs in its belief of Jesus, as not a prophet nor historical figure, but as God in human form. The Holy Trinity is the concept that God takes three forms: the Father, the Son (Jesus), and the Holy Ghost (sometimes called Holy Spirit). Jesus taught the idea of instead of seeking revenge, one should love his or her neighbors and enemies. Christians believe that Jesus died on the cross to save humankind and forgive people's sins.

I babysat for Ania, Maren, Rea, and Milla tonight. It was a lot of fun. I can't wait to do it again. And I got paid $30 just for having fun with them for two hours. How great is that? Anyway, hopefully I'll be babysitting for them often enough that I'll be able to quit HT soon. Be praying!

The Blood Joker: find something, go outside, walk, listen to music, there's adventure all around you
geekfreak86: you sound like ghandi
The Blood Joker: lol, thanx, i suppose

Hey guys. I'm really sick, and the only good thing about it is that I don't have to work. In fact, that's such a good thing that I'm willing to suffer through several more days of this misery just so I don't have to go. Anyway, I've been sleeping almost nonstop since Wednesday night. I know I'm going to be endlessly behind in newspaper due to my inability to be productive. Oh well. I suppose it'll all work itself out in the end. There was something really exciting that happened Wednesday night, but I'd rather not post it here for the whole world to see. If you want to know, you are most welcome to ask me about it. Anyway, I'm going to go because I have a doctor's appointment in a few.
I hate whiny, self-absorbed people. The end.

Hey everyone. I just got off of work, and I'm exhausted. Anyone who talks to me at all knows how much I despise my job, but I tried really hard to have a good attitude. As I was walking in this afternoon, I prayed that God would help me get through it until I can find another job. You know what? It worked. I don't like my job or anything, but I met several really nice customers tonight. One had on a really neat scarf, another has a daughter at Chapel Hill who wants to be a teacher, and the other talked to me for a long time about nudity. It was really interesting. I feel like God put these people in my path to keep me from having a nervous breakdown. So, thank you Jesus! Anyway, I'm really excited about prom. Going with Steven is going to be so awesome. He's such a sweetie, and I really admire him. When I was talking to Thompson about prom and who I was going with, he said he was really excited for me. He told me I picked the best date possible, and that he thoroughly approved of Steven because "he's a really good guy!" I know I don't really need anyone's approval, but I was glad that I got it from him. Well, I went to hang out with Charlie last night, and I have to tell you that I think God was really protecting me from getting too close to him. We still had fun, but my eyes were really opened to just how dangerous it would be for me to date a non-Christian. I think we're going to hang out tomorrow night after I get off work, but I'm not worried about anything anymore. I know what I feel, and I feel really comfortable about the whole relationship now. We even talked about his situation (basically, he just got out of a really serious relationship, and he's not looking for a girlfriend). One thing he told me last night was that he thought girls my age were incredibly annoying and vapid. I was a little worried at first because I thought I was included in that generalization, but luckily that wasn't the case. He continued, saying that I had really impressed him because I was so intelligent. I know it's not the kind of comment a guy makes when he's hitting on you (another reason I'm not worried), but it still meant a lot to me. I would much rather be praised for my intelligence than for being pretty. Well, I'm done babbling. I just wanted to update now before I get slammed with work, babysitting, church, and a million other things. Please keep my job situation in your prayers. I would really appreciate it.

Charlie's back from Alabama. Yay! I saw him tonight and we're planning to do something on Wednesday before church. Maybe I'll even be able to convince him to go with me. Anyway, when I visited him this time he told me I was pretty and then he hugged/held me. Awww. I'm still grinning. It reminds of this line in a Matchbook Romance song that says, "I'll be going through withdrawal of you for this one night we have spent." Well, I'm going to go listen to music and be bored.

Okay, so I know I haven't updated in awhile. I've been working every day, and when I haven't I've been doing homework. I feel like I have no life anymore. At least I got to go to Tremont with Laura last night for the Epitaph Tour. It was soooooooo awesome. Being the genius that I am, I decided to wear flip-flops and then get smashed in the very front with jumping, crazy people. It was worth it though. I got to be in the very front when Matchbook Romance came up. It was so energetic, and I got completely caught up with it. I think it's the most fun I've had in a long time. Today I came into school over an hour late because my stepdad has decided he will no longer wash my clothes and I had nothing to wear. Therefore, I did started a load of laundry and slept while they were in the dryer. I came in just in time to hear John Baker speak in chapel, and it was great. I'm really glad I didn't miss it. I was so impressed with the way he let God speak through him, and it just blessed me so much. Well, anyway, I'll try to update again as soon as I get a chance.

This definitely amused me. If you know Dyl, check out his lj. His rejected crayon is WAY better than mine.
You are
What Rejected Crayon Are You?

Went to return "Raising Helen" and ran into Charlie. He asked me to come back in 30 minutes, so I did. He gave me his band's CD and wrote his phone number on it. Told me he would call me after he got off work. Gave me a hug and kissed me on the top of the head. Said I was cute. 


Smiling.

I'm having one of those nights that I know is going to end in lighting candles, listening to sad music, writing depressing poetry, and making myself sick from crying. Please don't bother to offer your sympathy. This entry is more for me than for you.

Charlie (the guy at Blockbuster) asked for my phone number last night. I hope he calls.

Donny and I are talking again. It's weird, and it makes me very nervous.

I'm starting to miss Graeson. I'm am therefore extremely disgusted with myself. Boo me!

I have my first day of actual work tomorrow after church. That ought to be interesting. Pray for me. I really don't want to go.

Well, I'm going to leave you with a few lines from an amazing song. Remember, life is full of disappointments, but each disappointment has a song dedicated to it.

 

And we'll sing out loud for hours / 'Till the morning that we know we can't avoid / These nights are notable and priceless / I swear that every word I say I mean until my dying day / It's a shame when I wake I can't recall a thing   -David Melillo

Well, Donny came to church last night (Lauren, your comments are unwanted). I was really nervous, but I was also excited to see him. I'm not even gonna go any further with that topic though. I really don't want to give away too much.

Anyway, I'm feeling really overwhelmed right now, what with work, school, homework, and church. Separately, those things aren't bad at all, but when you combine them all, it makes for a 18-hour day. I rarely get my homework done anymore. I definitely need your prayer on that one.

Another prayer request is for my uncle, Wayne Ward. If you want to know more specifically how to pray for him, ask me and I'll be happy to explain the situation. I'm just too rushed right now to type the whole story out. 

Thanks for your concern, and I appreciate your prayers.

Have you ever heard a song for the first time and it just made you want to cry? And I'm not talking about after you hear certain lyrics in it; I mean before the words are even sung. You hear that intro and your breathing slows, you listen more closely, and longing fills your heart to its bursting point. It doesn't happen often due to most popular artists' utter lack of creativity, but if you happen upon a little know band, you might get lucky. They're the ones that give the rest of us hope.

Psalm 138 (KJV)
   1I will praise thee with my whole heart: before the gods will I sing praise unto thee. 

   2I will worship toward thy holy temple, and praise thy name for thy lovingkindness and for thy truth: for thou hast magnified thy word above all thy name. 

   3In the day when I cried thou answeredst me, and strengthenedst me with strength in my soul. 

   4All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O LORD, when they hear the words of thy mouth. 

   5Yea, they shall sing in the ways of the LORD: for great is the glory of the LORD. 

   6Though the LORD be high, yet hath he respect unto the lowly: but the proud he knoweth afar off. 

   7Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me: thou shalt stretch forth thine hand against the wrath of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me. 

   8The LORD will perfect that which concerneth me: thy mercy, O LORD, endureth for ever: forsake not the works of thine own hands.

~mistakenheart~

My livejournal no longer excites me. I feel disconnected, hurried, antsy. I think it's just my need to be in a new place. I've lived in North Carolina, Charlotte, and even the same house my whole life! I hate waking up and knowing I have to endure another day in the official--and very realistic-- simulation of Hades (a.k.a. HGBCS). I dread school. I feel like I'm just surviving, not really living. It's frustrating. I want to be passionate. Bah.

Moving on, I don't have my article written for Mr. Hicks because I have yet to interview Paul. I have been somewhat busy, but I know I could have tried harder to track him down than I did. The guilt is overwhelming (and that really is not sarcasm). I hate letting people down, especially my elders. It doesn't help that Mr. Hicks is one of the few teachers that I actually love and respect with all my heart. *le sigh* I know he'll get over it, but I so hate disappointing him.

However, my mom just sent me an e-mail that was kind of cheesy, but really uplifting. It was talking about different people who survived 9/11 because they were late to work for various reasons. One was late because he got stuck in traffic. Another was late because she spilled her breakfast on herself and had to go home to change clothes. Still another was late because her son wasn't ready on time for her to take him to school. It was a lot of little things like this that are so annoying when they happen, but they were better off annoyed than dead. 

Even though it's not likely that me missing a homework assignment or being late to school will save my life, it makes me realize that God has a purpose, even in the tiny details like that. Those annoyances are part of God's plan, and He has a reason for everything that happens in my life.

Anyway, I might as well do my devotions and go to bed early since I don't have a way to finish my article tonight. It's still frustrating, but I'm trying to concentrate on the fact that God still loves me and has everything figured out. I hope you all realize the same thing.
